name: Melia Buenos Aires Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here 4 nights on business - company chose the hotel. The location is pretty good for the Microcentro and access to e.g. San Telmo and Puerto Madero. The Microcentro is the shopping area and tends to be heavily polluted, though this didn't affect our stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Good location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room (we were on the 9th., top floor with veranda) was a good size and comfortable but a tad tired. A/C was either on or off - no temperature control. But it was very comfortable and quiet. Service was also very good throughout the hotel. Breakfast was good if uninspiring.
reviews.title: clean/good location

reviews.text: Internet on the 9th floor was poor - fluctuating connection, and you had to pay for it. It was a weakness.
reviews.title: Excellent room in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd actually give this 3.5 stars - good place for a weekend break, for example
reviews.title: Great room

reviews.text: We stayed two nights pre cruise. The hotel was clean with a great location. We stayed in the 2nd tower and had no noise issues. Bathroom had lots of little extras.
reviews.title: First time in Buenos Aires

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved the location. Walking distance to most things including a shopping mall, tourist attractions and restaurants. We had the most beautiful tasting steak at a restaurant only a couple of doors down.
reviews.title: Great spot and room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception was good, they could speak English well (unlike most people in Buenos Aires - very hard to order things to eat outside).
reviews.title: Nice centrally located hotel

reviews.text: Free internet available in the foyer.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but avoid room 317

reviews.text: The room was nice. We were worried about facing the street, but it was fine, we weren't kept awake at night.
reviews.title: Safe pick - good hotel in a good location

reviews.text: The staff at Melia was very helpful and spoke great English. The room was nice and clean. I preferred the Palermo neighborhood but this was a great hotel for the price.
reviews.title: Good hotel, clean and cheap.

reviews.text: Because airspace was closed at the Valdes Peninsula (ashes coming from a Chilean volcano), we unexpectedly came back to BA and booked this hotel for 2 nights. Usually, I spend time on TA to identify the best possible choice, but this time as I had to book it in a hurry before leaving the hotel at our previous location. It was anyway a good choice, because it’s very central, with lot of bars, restaurants, shops and places to visit within walking distance. Room was fine, staff too, Melia is a good hotel.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only downward, no free wifi available, a too often shame in our era.
reviews.title: lack of care for customers

reviews.text: In September I booked on the Melia website a room for 3 nights in November and entered my credit card details for what I thought was just the usual guarantee. At that point it was not made clear on their website that they will charge me for the whole amount 3 more than months in advance, which they unfortunately did charge! I phoned the hotel to say I wish to pay at check-out (=the norm) and challenge their unusual practice to charge so quickly, especially as they didn't warn about it in advance and, the next day, that charge disappeared from my account and my bank said the money had been refunded. Therefore I cancelled the entire reservation as I was unhappy with this hotel's operating manner. A few days later I had the unpleasant surprise to find that the money had, again, been taken from my account by Melia hotel and now they refused to let us stay at the hotel for those 3 nights, saying the reservation was cancelled. How convenient for them, to charge the money >3 months in advance but not provide us with any services. I repeatedly contacted boh Melia Buenos Aires hotel and the Melia hotel chain head office but received useless or indifferent replies. Luckily my wonderful bank refunded me the money for the ilegitimate transaction that Melia Buenos Aires hotel carried out against my good will. Save yourself and stay in a different hotel, or else they will just treat you as a source of money but not as a person, they have no custmer service whatsoever!
reviews.title: Good Location by day, not by night; Inconsistent service & rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Melia several times on business and the location, while great during the day, rapidly deteriorates at night... it is the red light district and prostitutes regularly wait outside the hotel. As a female traveler I have never felt unsafe in the area even so (& even alone late at night) but I have had a prostitute steal my pizza outside! The rooms range from great to so-so. All of the views I've had are bad; my first room had a great bathroom, my latest (same room class) had a small bathroom and a cracked outside window. Room service was very poor and failed to clean the room several times. If the staff suspect that you speak English, even if your Spanish is fluent, they will speak to you in English. This is really inopportune, for example, the time that I sent a dress for dry-cleaning which had minor pilling on it (on the side where I carry my brief case); they kept the dress, though it should have been deliverd hours earlier, and left a note instead saying: "We are sorry, your dress is threadbare." While it came back just as I had expected, it caused me a lot of stress in the FOUR HOURS they took to track it down. On my latest visit we were somehow not listed as having breakfast included on days 4 and 5 though 1,2 & 3 had been included...all on the same breakfast-included reservation. I got yelled at by the guy at reception as if I were a thief. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are a good size, but if you are looking for good service or any sort of personal touch go elsewhere. You can do a lot better for the price. The towels in my latest room were on the other side of a large, slippery-floored bathroom, with no hooks nearby to hang them on...otherwise the bathroom was great.
reviews.title: Good value, but a little outdated!

reviews.text: I've been in this hotel in April with my wife and a couple of friends.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - only downfall is that it doesn't have free wireless

reviews.text: We recently held an event in the hotel convention centre, I cannot recommend the hotel and staff enough for their professionalism and willingness to accommodate during the event. The meeting facilities are good and the catering excellent.
reviews.title: Great for business and pleasure

reviews.text: Whether for business or pleasure the hotel is conveniently situated on a pedestrian street with many bars and restaurants nearby, lots with tables and chairs in the street great for people watching. I would recommend two nearby parrillas with great steak - El Estabon and Al Carbon, both just a minutes walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Time to update

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned by others go for the room rate with breakfast included - this will set you up for the day.
reviews.title: Excellent for a Weekend escapade

reviews.text: I have been to this property several times. Yes, I agree with most of the latest reviews. However, I think it is time for the ownership to start looking into updating the main building's rooms; some fixtures in the bathrooms and the air conditinioning are definitely showing their age. Bad caulking in the bathtub does not belong to this type property.
reviews.title: Great hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet is slow at times.
reviews.title: Good hotel in the heart of BA

description: Welcome to the Meliá Buenos AiresOur most important objective is to provide you with a warm and welcoming atmosphere for you to enjoy to the full.This modern hotel provides 209 spacious and comfortable rooms including Standard Rooms, Superior Rooms, Deluxe Rooms, Junior Suites, Executive Suites and Premium Suites. All the rooms have been carefully designed and combine elegance, quality service and the latest technology, as well as modern temperature control systems and soundproofing.The rooms are fully equipped with individually controlled central heating, LCD TV, desk, broad band Internet connection and WiFi, 2 telephone lines, minibar, safe, kettle, shoe-shine service and 24 hour room service.
